com.rpfsoftwares.systembuilderlib.database

Class JMySQLHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rpfsoftwares.systembuilderlib.database.JMySQLHelper

  • public class JMySQLHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to help you connect with MySQL databases. Simply pass your database settings to the constructor and call the helper methods (insert, select, update, delete) from the object you created. Example: JMySqlHelper db= new JMySqlHelper("localhost","database1","root","password")
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Rosário Pereira Fernandes

    • Constructor Detail

      • JMySQLHelper

        public JMySQLHelper(java.lang.String server,
                    java.lang.String database,
                    java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String password)
        Instantiates the Helper. Used to open the database connection.
        Parameters:
        server - - MySQL Server Address (e.g: localhost,127.0.0.1)
        database - - database name
        username - - username used to access the database
        password - - password for this user.

        Insert data in a specific table.
        Parameters:
        tableName - - Name of the table where we want to insert data
        pairs - - JContentValues with the attribute name binded to the value to insert
        Returns:
        boolean - returns true if it is successfully inserted, or false if not

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        - ResultSet containing the table values, or null if couldn't query for data.

      • select

        public java.sql.ResultSet select(java.lang.String tableName,
                                 java.lang.String[] columns,
                                 java.lang.String where,
                                 java.lang.String order,
                                 int limit,
                                 int offset)
        Get table rows in a specific order, limit and offset
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the table where we want to query for data.
        columns - Columns to be selected
        where - the WHERE query
        order - the ORDER BY query
        limit - the LIMIT query
        offset - the OFFSET query
        Returns:
        ResultSet with the table data, or null if couldn't query for data

public java.sql.Connection getConnection()

      • close

        public void close()
        Used to close the database connection. Please remember to close the connection on every Class/Method when you no longer need it.

      • getForeignKey
